| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | [\[1\]](https://gist.github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/2c3897261f2b42e71745) |

A **nobleman** or **noblewoman** is a [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") added in the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") role patch, corresponding to the default version of the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") [role](/wiki/Role "Role") (as opposed to the elf, drow, and dwarf versions in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack")).

Like other player monsters, noblemen and noblewomen are never randomly generated (except in variants which enable random generation of player monsters) and are thus rarely seen. No noblemen or noblewomen are normally found outside the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), where they may appears among the hostile player monsters generated there.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Reading a cursed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") as a noble while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") will summon a number of noblemen or noblewomen, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using [undead turning](/wiki/Undead_turning "Undead turning") on the corpse or [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") on the statue of a dead noble left on a [bones level](/wiki/Bones_level "Bones level") will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. Nobleman and noblewoman corpses may be found in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"),[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) and a statue of a noble may appear on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Most nobles encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger"), which may temporarily assume the form of a nobleman or noblewoman.

## Equipment

A nobleman or noblewoman on the Astral Plane will carry a [rapier](/wiki/Rapier "Rapier"). The [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon")'s [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either [erodeproof](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") or [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") of the same type, if possible.

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, nobles will also be equipped with [1d3](/wiki/D_notation "D notation") random [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), 1d3 random [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), 1d3 random [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"), some [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), and a [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor"). The noble's ascension kit will include [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") and an [opera cloak](/wiki/Opera_cloak "Opera cloak"), as well as other randomly selected pieces of equipment.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [create\_mplayers](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c#create_mplayers "Source:Mplayer.c") in [mplayer.c](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c "Source:Mplayer.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [dat/gehennom.des in NetHack 3.4.3, line 65](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/dat/gehennom.des#line65 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/dat/gehennom.des")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [sp\_lev.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1004](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/sp_lev.c#line1004 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/sp lev.c"): *the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [mk\_mplayer](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c#mk_mplayer "Source:Mplayer.c") in [mplayer.c](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c "Source:Mplayer.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [Monsters' Equipment Spoiler](http://www.doc.ic.ac.uk/~pgp/nh/moninvent-343.txt) by Boudewijn Waijers, Topi Linkala and Philip Potter

Noble (player monster)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ nobleman / noblewoman
Difficulty 12
Attacks Weapon 2d6 physical
@ nobleman / noblewoman
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Weapon 2d6 physical

Base level 10
Base experience 216
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 1
Alignment 3 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

A nobleman or noblewoman:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is male.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A nobleman also:

  • is male.

A noblewoman also:

  • is female.
Reference [1]

A nobleman or noblewoman is a player monster added in the Noble role patch, corresponding to the default version of the Noble role (as opposed to the elf, drow, and dwarf versions in dNetHack).

Like other player monsters, noblemen and noblewomen are never randomly generated (except in variants which enable random generation of player monsters) and are thus rarely seen. No noblemen or noblewomen are normally found outside the Astral Plane, where they may appears among the hostile player monsters generated there.[1]

Reading a cursed scroll of genocide as a noble while confused will summon a number of noblemen or noblewomen, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using undead turning on the corpse or stone to flesh on the statue of a dead noble left on a bones level will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. Nobleman and noblewoman corpses may be found in the Valley of the Dead,[2] and a statue of a noble may appear on Medusa's Island.[3]

Most nobles encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be doppelgangers, which may temporarily assume the form of a nobleman or noblewoman.

Equipment

A nobleman or noblewoman on the Astral Plane will carry a rapier. The weapon's enchantment will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either erodeproof or greased (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an artifact of the same type, if possible.

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, nobles will also be equipped with 1d3 random offensive items, 1d3 random defensive items, 1d3 random miscellaneous items, some gold, and a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor. The noble's ascension kit will include chain mail and an opera cloak, as well as other randomly selected pieces of equipment.[4][5]

References

  1. ↑ create_mplayers in mplayer.c
  2. ↑ dat/gehennom.des in NetHack 3.4.3, line 65
  3. ↑ sp_lev.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1004: the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments
  4. ↑ mk_mplayer in mplayer.c
  5. ↑ Monsters' Equipment Spoiler by Boudewijn Waijers, Topi Linkala and Philip Potter

A '''nobleman''' or '''noblewoman''' is a [[player monster]] added in the [[Noble]] role patch, corresponding to the default version of the [[Noble]] [[role]] (as opposed to the elf, drow, and dwarf versions in [[dNetHack]]).

Like other player monsters, noblemen and noblewomen are never randomly generated (except in variants which enable random generation of player monsters) and are thus rarely seen.
No noblemen or noblewomen are normally found outside the [[Astral Plane]], where they may appears among the hostile player monsters generated there.<ref>{{function|mplayer.c|create_mplayers}}</ref>

Reading a cursed [[scroll of genocide]] as a noble while [[confused]] will summon a number of noblemen or noblewomen, although they won't have their usual equipment.  Using [[undead turning]] on the corpse or [[stone to flesh]] on the statue of a dead noble left on a [[bones level]] will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. Nobleman and noblewoman corpses may be found in the [[Valley of the Dead]],{{refsrc|dat/gehennom.des|65|nethack=3.4.3}} and a statue of a noble may appear on [[Medusa's Island]].{{refsrc|sp_lev.c|1004|comment= the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments}}

Most nobles encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be [[doppelganger]]s, which may temporarily assume the form of a nobleman or noblewoman.

== Equipment ==

A nobleman or noblewoman on the Astral Plane will carry a [[rapier]].  The [[weapon]]'s [[enchantment]] will be random between  +4 and +8, and it will be either [[erodeproof]] or [[greased]] (but not both) with 33.3% probability each.  There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an [[artifact]] of the same type, if possible.

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, nobles will also be equipped with [[d notation|1d3]] random [[offensive item]]s, 1d3 random [[defensive item]]s, 1d3 random [[miscellaneous item]]s, some [[gold]], and a [[cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor]]. The noble's ascension kit will include [[chain mail]] and an [[opera cloak]], as well as other randomly selected pieces of equipment.<ref>{{function|mplayer.c|mk_mplayer}}</ref><ref>[http://www.doc.ic.ac.uk/~pgp/nh/moninvent-343.txt Monsters' Equipment Spoiler] by Boudewijn Waijers, Topi Linkala and Philip Potter</ref>
